bill_title: prohibit the introduction of certain contaminated agriculture products.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the introduction of certain contaminated agriculture products. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may transport any agricultural product or livestock into this state from another state or nation or to pass through this state with an agricultural product from another state or nation unless the product or livestock has a phytosanitary or sanitary certificate stating that: (1) The agricultural product or livestock does not contain any chemical levels in excess of established maximum residue limits; (2) The agricultural product or livestock shows no trace of any chemical for which no maximum residue limit has been established; and (3) The agricultural product or livestock shows no trace of any chemical not approved for use on the agricultural product or livestock in this state. Section 2. For purposes of this Act, the term, agricultural product, means crops, crop products, or plants, but does not include products for the sole consumption of the transporter or the transporter's family. The term, livestock, does not include products for the sole consumption of the transporter or the transporter's family. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. This Act is effective on July 1, 2001.
